metadata.Title: CVE-2021-28952 on Ubuntu 23.10 (mantic) - low.
metadata.Description:
An issue was discovered in the Linux kernel through 5.11.8. The sound/soc/qcom/sdm845.c soundwire device driver has a buffer overflow when an unexpected port ID number is encountered, aka CID-1c668e1c0a0f. (This has been fixed in 5.12-rc4.) John Stultz discovered that the audio driver for Qualcomm SDM845 systems in the Linux kernel did not properly validate port ID numbers. A local attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (system crash) or possibly execute arbitrary code.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-28952` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.5.0-10-generic - 5.15.0-25.25
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-10-generic - 5.15.0-25.25
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-10-generic-64k - 5.15.0-25.25
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1009-aws - 5.15.0-1004.6
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1008-azure - 5.15.0-1003.4
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1008-gcp - 5.15.0-1003.6
No subscription required
